google_play_reviews.content: Extremely useful, unintrusive app. Easy to use; easy to get up and running. Seems respectful of privacy.
The other org mode apps are nowhere close to this good. This is the app you want if you want to make use of org mode on mobile
I'm having an issue with mgit and orgzly, for some reason some of my org files are removed from git when they are edited.
It only allows to use * as hierarchy. It should allow users to configure the character so that # can be used. In that case the note can be used as org mode as well as markdown mode. Sync now broken!
Simple and straightforward, does it's job well.
Amazing application!!! Having org mode on my phone makes a huge difference to my productivity. Thank you.
Freed me from paying Evernote!
Thank you for making this app.
The syncing to local dir seems completely borked for quite a while now. Even relinking or adding new files results in orgzly complaining that there is a conflict. This in my case is with Syncthing.

Just Wow! The only app that's a real superhero. Restored all its data in my new phone exactly as I had saved it in my old damaged phone. My go-to app for storing stuff I know I'll need later. My personal HDD
Absolutely awesome! You can edit Emacs Org mode files. I hope developer continues to improve app. In any case, it works great.

It does for you what YOU want. For me it was syncing my notes and todolists which I wrote in Emacs org mode, I store them in Dropbox and that's how I can access them from my phone. This app is perfect for then opening and editing those org files. The edited file syncs with Dropbox and when I sit down on my laptop I get to see things I edited on the road. Perfect for capting ideas too
confusing :'(

Simply awesome for orgmode users! Love the UI, themes, and the widget. Custom search, and the sync are great features. It supports notifications+snooze and simple reminders too! Bugs: 1. The background opacity for widget doesn't work on my phone (Samsung Galaxy). 2. Monospace font doesn't work. Feature Requests: 1. Undo (say, when editing note, marking agenda item as done, refiling note, etc). 2. Ability to set completion time.

Good, but I cannot seem to copy what I see (Note book outline, portion of outline, etc) to an email. I can go in an copy the text in each iten, but that would br the opposite of productivity and I would not have need of the app. It's not been a deal breaker yet, as the app is very useful, but does not seem to a want to play nice with the other apps. Which seems to be a big oversight for those users who would like it to be a part of a workflow.
Didn't like all the 1 stars unreplied to.

There is a learning curve to this app. If you have used Emacs, or specifically Org mode this will be very familiar. The power of this app is how you have the flexibility to store data how you want, and can set up searches to display it in a way that is filtered (tags, dates, states, etc.), and sorted. You can create repeating tasks quite easily. I use this for tracking meetings, appointments, tasks, birthdays, wishlist, and a variety of notes. You can even add pictures and links.

finally a good org-mode app for Android! I only wish we'd have more innately configured properties (like time tracking). you can of course use any property you like, but it'd be nice to get some gui :). so good though!!
I really like the app, but Linking files and quotes are not working for me. :/
Good app to read org files in mobile device.
Please add support for customised todo entries i.e. I have defined multiple todo types in my org file but they they dont show up in todo for orgzly but do show up for todo in org-agenda
Fantastic app. I recommend it unreservedly.
I was never thought that this app could be present and free for Android. It's org mode that just available for emacs and so for this app.
great app to save my todo and note, and sync to nextcloud

Set WebDAV details, test and "Connection successful" comes up. Create note and "No connection" comes up. So much for WebDAV. Uninstalled even though it looks like a really nice app. Without the sync I can't use it.
The most powerful and customizeble app i could find!
Minimalistic, beautiful and effective
非常感谢

One screen (Repositories setting) says connection successful but sync says no connection. Either I have a connection or I don't. Which screen should I believe? It won't sync so I guess the repositories setting screen is only pretending to connect. I need a true connection so I'll have to try a different app.
You have to create notebooks in order to write notes. You just can't write notes.
Simply an amazing way to access your tasks from org mode filled that you can then edit on your desktop.

Excellent app, and free & free of Adds ! Much kudos, keep up the updates and adding features. I find it the best solution (after some search) to sync tasks & todos on laptop and mobile phone, by use in conjunction with Organice , via shared files on Dropbox. Wish to see improvements in menus, add and move notes. Not as easy in creating a simple grocery list. Wish for a more organized Agenda view(s). Reaching top row controls - is not convenient when operating single hand. Wonderful work!
does it support images
Seriously, how can I give you some money? Do you have a place to donate? I use this every single day to view my Emacs tasks and database.
Would like to have image attachment. And colored tags or notes please.
Honestly? It's good. But it's just not that user friendly so I'm leaving a 5 star but I'm not gonna use this a main notes app.
Amazing app, just plain text, simple and efficient notes management
I regularly use org mode and this app was the missing link for me. Being able to access my to-do list anywhere is great, and notifications for scheduled tasks is a godsend.
Good underrated app
Feature Request: GDrive or OneDrive support for auto sync? Thank you.
Brilliant! Highly customizable and a wonderful user experience through its ease of use.
An integral part of my productivity system
This app is great. Thanks so much!

I'm happy that this exists. I would love to have some easy to use clocking feature though UPDATE 2022-08-31: With the last update some functionality seems broken for me: I am no longer able to scroll inside a nodes text when I want to select text that doesnt fit the screen all at once

Change for change's sake. Imagine if someone suddenly changes the color pallete of software you've been using for years with no option to keep the previous colors? Why not provide a "grey" theme option for the previous colors?
Need the git functionality to work then I might give it a 4 star rating
Backlinks doesn't work

Best app for org mode. It was difficult to get into at first, even though I use org mode on my PC with emacs but it could be explained by the complexities of org mode itself. When you get how it all works it is the most powerful and easy to use note taking app I could imagine.
Frequently losing data since upgrade to Android 12. Back to Notion.
Super happy that I found this. Org mode on steroids. The Swiss army knife of todo apps. Pity that there isn't a Windows version.

Best Emacs org mode agenda reader on Android. Took off stars because as a todo app it could use work - editing lists is slow and uncomfortable. Things that make mobile todo apps usable like swipe actions (e.g., swipe left to complete task, swipe right to reschedule) are missing. Instead long presses (slow) bring up a menu of tiny icons which are hard to select, or select task and switch screens for scattered buttons. WARNING: may clobber your org file formatting. Recommend read-only.

How to display sub headings in search results? It seems like I'm missing something. The search is useless when it shows me only heading name, metadata (or direct text, when I turn it on in options). I'd like to see (or jump to) all sub headings in search screen and move through them (expand/collapse/etc) like in main screen.
This app makes orgmode viable on Android for people whose primary frame of reference is Linux.
Everything you would want from Org-mode on your phone, presented in a clean and elegant manner.
I live in Emacs, and Orgzly helps me add/check off things on the go. It takes some tweaks to prevent weird formatting if you have an opinionated workflow. But its been great.

Best app so far, I got slightly confused how to navigate this app but I guess the Google helps me a lot. Orgzly is free and the app doesn't demand for pennies which I highly recommended. The system works a lot to me and I hope it'll get lots of users within this year ahead. God bless!!!
Would love to have sync to git repo working.
Great at what it does! Often an Overkill. Open source and integrated well with emacs and org mode. They should include an option to donate or have a premium version of the app.
Hi. I wonder how to share notes? Thank you

Oh, I love the app. I tried different Todo apps, but none of them worked for me, but this one is just great. Special thanks for not doing the subscription model. If there would be a pro version, or "But me a coffee", I would be happy to do that

It's the best app for todo's I've tried, and it's smart, the fact it syncs with dropbox automatically allows to see and edit your notes in the pc (although that's also thanks to the org format); [REQUEST #1] Allow to set event hours without a reminder (optional reminders) [REQUEST #2] A calendar integrated to the search results, for example, at the top (if enabled for that search query); it would be so cool to have in my "Agenda" search query [REQUEST#3] Allow to sync markdown/.md files!

Amazingly the main list of all your projects is only sortable by name or date! How about allowing me to sort the list according to importance? And I'm looking for a future that prints out the outline so that within any outline point there is text!
The app is excellent. Git support should be added to better handling conflicts with the notes.
Functionality improving
So is this app.
App is dead. No longer opens. Regret updating.
Works really well with the Dropbox integration.
Lifesaver.
I've only two words: Thank You.
Easy to use. Polished. Clean. Awesome. Only app i need that makes organizing my day acually fun.

Already loving it. I downloaded this app yesterday, and I'm in love with it. I'm a fan of making lists anyway and have been looking for an app to making it easier and more enjoyable. I've pretty much decided this is how I'm going to keep track of every aspect of my life now! It has so many useful features, some of them are quite complicated, but you can just use the ones you want. And there's a handy guide for when you get stuck. Really impressed with this app. Thank you!
A really nice idea with a nice interface. Unfortunately the synchronisation can be a bit flaky sometimes over cloud storage.
Excellent implementation of Org-Mode.
I am using it. Very happy. Thanks
Not like Emacs but enough for maintaining task list.
This is an excellent mobile org mode browser and editor. Notebooks can be synced via Dropbox. It works well for most things.
If you like or need emacs org-mode, then this app is for you.
Most essential functions are there. The syncing functionability could be improved
Super useful companion to the best task / project / life management system in existence - Emacs Org Mode.
Best outliner apps for keeping notes in Org format. Just adding Markdown language will make this app more perfect.
miss fenced code and org tables' support very much. org-roam support in general would be also very welcome. apart from that - great app!

Functional, simple, does one thing but does it good, no-frills app, no ads, offline as far as I can tell. In general what I need, however there is one thing... lets say I want to save notes, set up sync with local folders: phone memory and SD card. Orgzly recognizes only one of them (whichever was used in previous sync session). So it is "either/or" and not "and/and" situation. Don't know if remote directories are affected. Android10 Samsung Galaxy A6 (2018)
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Multiple repositories are supported, but only for a different set of notebooks in the app. A single notebook in the app can only be synced to a single repository. Hope that answers the question. Thanks for the review!

google_play_reviews.content: Absolutely phenomenal. Thanks for this!
Great work; it's not easy to find such a well-done org files reader and writer. Keep it up folks!
I have no words! It's a Masterpiece.
The concept is perfect. Thank you for this great app. Please continue the good work.
Everyone who uses Emacs knows the value of this app. For me, this is the best app on the Google Play. Thank to the developers for making my life easier🙏

I really appreciate your efforts of making this great app free, despite Orgzly is far ahead of many paid outliner, but please attend this underlined issues urgently: 1. Whenever I received a shared note from other apps the paragraphs are removed, the whole sentences are freezed together. 2. Link configuration is complex for novice like me: up till now no headway for successful set-up! This feature is my attraction to this app. Pls make link configuration simple as obtained in UpNote. Thanks
Very good and simple interface. The swipe actions are finicky to do with your thumb.
Best org mode integration. Really effective.
Absolutely first-rate app. My eternal gratitude to the developers.
Definitely underrated
Great idea, decent interface, and many useful features such as agenda, tags, and scheduled reminders. Doesn't support syncing with Google Drive.
I mostly use it for reading my org files and for notifications on my agenda. Works great.
Great for keeping my org mode files with me while on the go. I use orglzly alongside syncthing to keep everything up to date and it pretty much just works.
Amazing app to take your org knowledge base on the go. I suggest to use syncthing to sync org files directly, it works super reliable.
Thanks for directory sync feature. Encryption should be essential feature although
superb! this is just the most useful app i have ever used....thank you...
please let use [Enter] in the titles
Awesome app ! Just need a lil'bit user friendly in terms of Android-users, requires more controls for data representation - views!!

Great initially, but now I find that notes I had saved just disappear. I'll save the note, exit and go back in and they are there. Two weeks later, I go back in to remind myself of a note, but the contents have disappeared.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Do you explicitly save the note by clicking the checkmark icon? After that, they only way note should disappear is if you're syncing the notebook and do a "Force Load". Drop us an email so we can debug this. Thank you!

google_play_reviews.content: I started out with a bunch of org-files in a WEBDAV folder, which I edit with Orgzly and other tools. Gradually, Orgzly has been loosing links. Now, all files are either "Notebook has no link and one or more ..." or, after I set the link manually, "Link and remote Notebook exist but ...". The only way to sync is to overwrite one with the other. But I don't know the differences and I wouldn't know which to choose. I compare a few, but they seem to be identical.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Drop us an email so we can debug this. Also, check out http://www.orgzly.com/help#0eb6241. Thanks for the review!

google_play_reviews.content: Great app. for daily use
Support for multiple timestamps per item would be helpful.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Plain timestamps are already supported (in agenda and reminders). There's still no UI for them though, so you have to write them manually. Thanks for the review!

google_play_reviews.content: Great app..looking forward to use it..the app has great potential but need to be user friendly..specifically for searches i can't suggest this app to everyone as it requires complex understanding of query. Please make search user friendly. Try to add calender..the code is open but i don't have such level of knowledge to write app...hope suggestions will reflect soon..Using it.

Good for a free up. Hope it will not ask for money someday.. Unless providing some good additional functions like setting the look not just by tumblrs, etc, maybe some presets... Well, 5 stars is 5 stars
Best org mode app ever! Just discovered the advanced search functions and I am hooked forever to this app. Thanks to the author and contributers!

If you put a little time into setting up org mode and have a nice productivity system like MYN or GTD this app works AMAZINGLY well for keeping the important things in view. Fantastic implementation, frankly I think the best available - and I have tried many.
It is a good thing that can use emacs-org in android.
It's perfect! All of my described issues got solved, what an amazing and kind developer! Thank you for releasing this marvel of an app!

I have used this for a few years. excellent development and regular improvements. would just like to see custom background colour setting , global or per notebook. Also an option to insert inactive timestamps like [2019-03-30] without having to type them. I use this app daily for notes, agenda, Todo, reminders, shopping list etc.

Great app to sync, browse and edit Emacs Org Mode files, with an user interface which doesn't allow everything from Org Mode (not surprisingly), but is practical and quite faithful to the outlines based Org Mode spirit.
I use this with Syncthing to keep versions of my docs on my laptop.
Just love it!
I like how systematic this app is. Is there a way to change the level of an existing note?
google_play_reviews.replyContent: You can long-click the note and select "Move" from the overflow menu. Left and right arrows change the level. You could also cut and paste the note above, under or below a different one. Drag & drop will be implemented in the future to make this easier. Thanks for the review!

google_play_reviews.content: Nice. Will test and rate It again after experiência It.

Not very convenient, why so small text editing area in note taking app? Why so weird Todo list creation? Too much effort to create even simple things. Too much effort to create hierarchy, why not indent notes with long press?
Kindly add lock function. Your app is good and 80% adequate. Thanks.
look like this is what I was searching: org-mode, dropbox, sync, dark theme :)

Very good. Plenty of features. The only thing I wish would be better is auto syncing, it kind of doesn't work when the note is updated so I have to always press sync button other than that it's very good.
THE BEST OUT THERE!!! 👩‍💻 Suggestions: I really want a copy-paste feature of the individual notes, please? Color coding too😍
Been really liking the app, but after updating to Android 11, it is no longer able to sync to local repositories (directories on my device).
google_play_reviews.replyContent: We can't reproduce this, can you contact us at support@orgzly.com or open a GitHub issue with more details - any error message you're getting, type of repo URL ("file" or "content" scheme), device, etc. Thanks!

google_play_reviews.content: cool so far
10 mins in and I love you already 😍 Finally, the app that I wanted!

Amazing app! It needs an option to toggle auto scroll to bottom, because if I have like a hundred of notes - scrolling to the bottom to see the last note is not fun. Would be cool to have an easy way of creating to-do lists. Something like a note where sub-notes have checkboxes. Google drive sync would be very appreciated as well :D. I also thought that it'd be nice to have sub-notebooks or notebooks in notebooks.

Edit: Emojis arent veing synced properly. Please add option to auto generate title from text deived from the content section of any new notes being created. Joplin for example does it which saves time typing in mandatory titles. Needs encryption. Please add Backup settings option.
This is a great outliner app, and I've used them all! Its open and simple file format makes it future-proof. I wouldn't use any other app.
Awesome application for managing todo, works with emacs org mode
Can we display the foto below the link
Very good mobile client for Emacs' Org.
Synchronization , editting , storage org files ..and it is portable. Good work Devs.
Perfect
finally! org-mode everywhere! this app + syncthing is perfect for orgmode on the phone plus multiple computers at the same time!
I like this app. It is very fast and helpful.

Org-mode on my phone This app allows me to read and edit org-mode files on my phone. I sync them with sync thing and edit them with this program. It's interface allows me to fold and unfold text in a mobile interface. It does not support all of org-mode's advanced features, but the developer is gradually adding support for more and more.
Insanely good app . Great job storing the tasks as org files . Can easily sync to laptop.
neat app
Great app!
This is a very powerful note taking tool although it's not user friendly nor very intuitive.
Wish I'd known about this sooner... Great way to have your org mode files synced and always with you. Great app!
Thank you Developer for your profound kindness in sharing this extremely helpful app.
Great Tool especialy the sync in combination with a nextcloud in awesome. Feature req. Clock in/Out (Pomodoro?) would be a great Extension
Far too cumbersome for basic things like making lists, since each item requires a multi-step process. This also means you can't copy/paste lists from elsewhere.
Nothing special, very bland
Awesome in every possible way. Feature request: if possible, please add "export" feature. Thank You.
The app is great. > the thing is when i add a link to the file in my storage, the link got cut off of if there's a space between the file name.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: What kind of link? Can you drop us an email to support@orgzly.com? Thanks for the review!

google_play_reviews.content: Gets me grocery list from me emacs to me phone much goodly
Surprisingly good for a free app. Dropbox sync is great. Text format is great. Need a desktop/web and iOS version.
Outstanding tool.
Really fantastic - - exactly what I was looking for as a companion to org mode
I love this app, it just works.

One word: AMAZING. Infinte nested lists are great for documenting ideas as they come. Orgzly is fully free and open source. Thank you so much to the developer.😍 FEATURE REQUEST: 1) UNDO BUTTON 2) make the + icon to expand note a little bigger & may be put it inside a box or a circle to know the touch area. Accidental touches are in general a problem. May be swipe down from the plus icon to expand the note would be better.
This app makes all my organizational dreams come true. Simple, highly customizable, reliable, functional, light. Thank you so much ❤

This app is amazing. Very fast and reliable. Sync works really well. I had some trouble with setting a Dropbox sync at first (just FYI: it was a problem with a browser in which Dropbox login window was being opened, setting default system browser from FF to Chrome solved it for me). Non issues with the app whatsoever. The only wishfull thing I can think of that would make the app more magnificent, at least for me, would be to open ics files so that it'd create a task with due date etc from it.
Great combination of notes and todo list..just the right app I wanted.. Suggestion: Improve the dark theme. The color of the elements are not vibrant enough.

Perhaps the best outliner out there. It would be useful if one could put a subtree directly into the system clipboard (implicitly converting the subtree into a plain text). Currently, one has to export an entire outline to a text file and copy the relevant sections from inside a text editor (as far as I can undrestand).
It's easy to add or edit notes
After create a base note book, can't duplicate for similar projects
Doesn't get any better.
I am happy about it. That's what I need.
Emacs consumes yet another swath of my life. Feels good.
Please Add Google Drive Synchronization.
Best org-mode app in Android
Awesome! Wanted to get started with Orgmode but am not behind the computer enough for it to work for me. This is just perfect for my usecase. Thanks so much!

This is a wonderful app! Honestly, the best app that I've found for syncing agenda/reminders on the desktop and phone. Thank you so much for the good work. Could you guys please add sync with a github repository as a feature in the upcoming releases?

Amazing app! Thank you so much for creating and maintaining this. Works perfectly and I appreciate all the features, despite someone complaining there are now too many features. Only improvement, for my use cases, would be a calendar view for scheduled tasks as an alternative to the current list view, which is something we have in org-mode.
Incredibly intuitive, powerful app - useful for me as a developer.
This has to be the best app among all the options!!
... good ...

Absolutely wonderful app. I can put anything that comes to my mind. It will remind me to do my stuff, help me to track them, save things that i may need some day... And has the extraordinary widget to make it even better, making it easier to see things on the app. Your data will be saved in a plain text file, so if you decide to move on to another app or way of dealing with it in the future, it got you covered. I really dig this app, I'm seriously considering donating. Thanks, developer(s).

It appears there is a community of people using emacs to manage their do-lists. This app is based on that environment, it is therefore powerful and not entirely easy to use. It also has a lovely dark grey on charcoal colour scheme that is kind of unreadable. I'd like to use it, I hope to become able to.

This app is fantastic for something Free/Open Source. (There's not even any ads!) My only complaint is that reordering and reparenting notes isn't very discoverable. A note in the Getting Started notebook would be very helpful. Again, this app is excellent and I highly recommend it.

Mostly great. Searching is complex; no drag and drop for moving selected notes; no zooming in on subnotes so that they're not scrunched on the right hand side of the screen. Maybe I should help with these... Also, if there were a nice way to keep this in sync with a laptop copy, it would be 6 stars at least. 😁

First of all: It's open source! AWESOME! Although I'm not a big fan of org-mode (I'm using VIM for almost 15 years now) I really like the concepts behind org-mode. And this app really helps me to keep my notes and tasks in one single place. Besides this: You can tag everything so you also have non-linear content creation. What I miss by now: - if one heading has tags, show these also for all sub-headings Thanks in advance!

Just moved from another todo app. I like it thus far, but I am missing an option to have dismissing a notification (swipe left/right) automatically result in the rescheduling of a recurring note (and possibly also in the marking done of a non recurring one).
Orgzly is an amazing app! Combine it with orgmode+emacs on the desktop and Syncthing and you have a perfect GTD setup. @dev Keep up a great work!
the app is great. It's not fit to someone who don't use org-mode, but for them who use it's best. it's not have great UX, but it's due to flexibility of orgmode itself.
Fantastic app ! You can really set things up to it fits perfectly your way of working.
This app is awesome, but the the method to add entries is a little annoying, btw, i think the most comfortable way to add entries is like workflowy's which is more like org-mode in adding them.
Seems very promising. More comment after more use.
Fantastic!
One step closer to a seamless org mode tool
Very flexible, many options, and syncs to plain text files. Awesome to-do and notes app!

So if you're not using org, you may not need or want this. It's highly, unbelievably customizable, but the learning curve was pretty steep & I had to keep going back to the fairly terse user guide. For me the customizability is basically overkill; I only need it for tasks & to-do lists or shopping lists. I use a calendar app that is basically a better front end to the Android native GCalendar & syncs w/it online. THIS app is amazing. It's just way more than I need.
Very useful app.
Great. Simple, free and no permission issues. Thanks!
Very good companion app for Org Mode

A flexible mobile organizer with easy syncing abilities with Dropbox (and very well with your desktop, if you aren't scared of emacs/spacemacs). Simple notes, events, and checklists are all simply included in your notebooks. Notifications too.

Great app for those who use org mode to manage their daily tasks. This app gives the power of portability for those who use org agenda. Please keep it updating. Looking for more improvements! Quick suggestion: please add the feature where it automatically counts the no. of tasks done and shows it in the note title. This feature is present in org mode but not in orgzly Thanks!

Moved from Note Everything (not being upgraded). This is as close to it as I can find. Can't find anything better than this. However, Orgzly really really needs access to the camera. How do I get images into my notes? Yes, I have turned on the option in settings. Images have always been a necessity for complete notes. So not quite a 5 star note taker.
This is the one perfect app for org-mode on the go!
Amazing app. Very isefull.
Similar to Notion, which is good, but much lighter and faster. I like the fact that I can use icons for each note by changing states. Needs automatic online sync.
Absolutely perfect piece of software! You have am amazing feeling of what features should be packed into. R-right! ★★★★★

Excellent and useful app for me! I think auto-merge maybe a very convenient function when one needs to edit org files on both pc emacs and mobile Orgzly, and force-downloading from dropbox or force-uploading from local storage is not secure when sometimes a file is both edited and one I forget to update. Or a function of auto-sync from dropbox is equivalent too. Thanks and pleased to see this feature in next update version 😊
well made and very useful especially widgets use syncthing to sybc the apps across devices
best

Hello. great app! but i found someone kindly asking for a sharing feature. that comment was blocked as far as repeated. It was mororless an year ago. and still that feature doesn t exist. thank you for the great job
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Yes, it's not implemented yet but it's planned, see https://github.com/orgzly/orgzly-android/issues/69 and https://github.com/orgzly/orgzly-android/issues/99. Thank you for the review!

google_play_reviews.content: Has features others don't. More control; particularly fields and sorts that you can configure.

Org mode is simple to learn but there's so much under the hood and pretty much all of it is really useful. Orgzly is the most faithful and promising implementation on the phone. Sadly, a few features are missing (agenda view, sync with google drive/git/sshfs/...), but this is clearly a passion product and I have faith in the ongoing development.
its nice app - but for my main usecase would be opening existing org files to edit. but the app does not register itself as being able to open that file type... so i cant use this.

Great app for org on the go. Keep on doing guys. Some suggestions: Features: - support for stadistical cookies i.e. [1/3] stuff - Hability to choose color text for tags, priority and properties metadata Workflow: - Note interface; I think it would be more appealing to have: At the top of screen Note title, Note contents and then at the bottom of the screen a icons bar for the metadata, with the same icons already you have.
Best app for org files in my opinion. It is quite customizable. It really brings the power of org mode to your phone.
thank you so much! keep up the fantastic work!

In my opinion, this is an amazing app. Simple, clean, and powerful. I love it. Though, if an actual check box feature can be created, and not the bracket stuff, would be super cool. I almost missed it, and takes an extra step to create one. Thanks

I rarely ever leave reviews, but I was very surprised by the functionality of this app. It is extremely customizable, and has all the features of other checklist apps out there. A handy guide is also provided, so usage is not difficult. I would highly recommend using this app.

Tried many Task Mgr/Todo lists, this is by far the best! Manual is a little thin, but it is worth the time of having to play with the app to get familiar. Initially couldn't figure out how to add subnotes till I figured out the difference between short tap and tap and hold.

I'm surprised that not many people know about this app. I'll try my best to 
communicate about this app. It's free and opens source. This is the best 
part about it. And finally they are not analyzing your data to sell like 
every evil corp does nowadays..

i guess i had a review here but its not existed anymore. since its a notebook i do not have any nagitive attitude. but i think a progress status and a live client server can make this to a very usefull app for team planning. as a project control officer i use it for all my tasks in the construction site. and i guess it can be a great app if its including progress status. then i can model all the p6 plan inside my phone. its just a dream anyway but a good one. hails to the developer <3
Good dev. Happy droid user. Speed and function is what i came for speed and function is what i got. And a dark theme. :)

It's been only a day that I downloaded it, but I can't quit spending time with it. The customization is endless, and it is everything I looked for in a to-do app. Sync with Dropbox works flawlessly. I appreciate that it is free and I hope it stays that way.

This is a great app that produces future proof Todo and hierarchical lists. It's also an app whose development is community driven, so if you have a want , file a feature request and other developers have been adding them.
Exceptional
A wonderful app for emacs org mode. After a few weeks usage, I didn't see any quality issue. I wish it will suport the capture template soon.
Yay!
G8 App
If only I had something to sync the org file with.

could you make the widget as minimalistic, beautiful and customizable as in com.stuff.todo? just take a look. those typefaces, adjustible margins, roundable corners and no header (at least you could allow to hide it). also it possible to mark something as done with one tap. please, I'm begging. that app has so little functionality, but so beautifully made.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Looks good, thanks for the suggestion!

google_play_reviews.content: 开天辟地
la mejor, pero harto de que google borre mis reviews (todas de 5 estrellas)

Great, but I would prefer it to maintain directory structure rather than flattening all org files into a single list. I have a large org directory with many files and nested directories. Would be 5 star if I could configure the sidebar to behave as a directory tree.

It's great to have my org agenda on my phone. While it is not a full featured emacs experience, it is clear the developers have a good understanding and appreciation of org-mode. There's a lot of subtlety and functionality I'm finding the more i use it; some of my Orgzly searches and notebooks have inspired changes in my emacs setup. Looking forward to clocking in a future release.

A close-to-perfect mobile implementation of org-mode! Easily handles all my Org files. has a super useful widget to display my agenda or todo list. Only complaint is that syncing on Dropbox is manual, not automatic.

Great app! It's really helpful to have access to my org files on my phone. My only complaint is that you only get notifications on the scheduled time of each event. It would be great if I could set the notification to be some time before the actual scheduled deadline.
Wish i could import an image from phone and have the app do all the magic.
Awesome
A great task management app but be prepared to spend some settling time if you want it to work even better. But this is common to any app that provided significant functionality or flexibility.
please set this up as the default app to open any org files on the system
Has decent functionality and is free, no ads
Exactly what I needed.
Thank you. I've been looking for this for so long.
Truly Detailed but not so much user friendly, some buttons dont work. To elaborate, why would you have a To Do tab in the menu if it doesnt open when I press on it and other queries are the same case
damn! has everything i want in a sleek ui (just started using it)
It's a fantastic note program. But after years of development, it still doesn't complement Emacs well.
bäst
One of the most useful Android apps

UPDATE: thank you for the great support. Everything works fine now.  Can't get it to reliably sync between my different Dropbox endpoints. Whenever I change something on my PC, changes aren't being picked up by Orgzly, yet further changes on the app lead to a conflict on sync. I wish there was a way to just reset everything and copy from Dropbox manually to avoid this kind of problem.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: You can force-load the notebook, by long-pressing it and selecting that action from the menu. Drop us an email at support@orgzly.com about the sync issue, that should be working fine. Thanks!

google_play_reviews.content: Easy to use and compatible with emacs and on the desktop.
Getting better every update.
Great app ! Exactly the kind of tool I'm using everyday ! I love the widget too ! One thing though : can you add an option to select which Notebook will appear in the agenda (like org-agenda-files) ?
I recently switch to org-mode to manage my life and nowadays having a way to sync to mobile is mandatory. This app suits all my needs and more, its a fantastic piece of software, for free! Thanks!
Found this app after someone on Hacker News mentioned it was open-sourced. Having recently started using org-mode, this is an amazing app to keep my files in sync and make notes on-the-go.
This is the best note book i found in 2019. It allows me to record down my yearly achievement and alot of good features to set goals.
Amazing app. Was worried about reminder notifications during my switch to org-mode but this app rose splendidly to the occasion. Thank you 💓
I liked it but can't use it as daily note taking app because editing content is cumbersome.
I organise my life with orgmode. Orgzly means I can leave my laptop behind and not lose the ability to search, create and edit my notes.
Simple. Stable. No ads. Best app ever for Org mode.

Very good app! A cool feature would be if it was possible to easily move a note to another notebook in the property window of the note. Now you can see the notebook it is in, but you can't change it. But hey, it's an awesome app. Keep going!
Beautiful job. Thanks a million.
Please put a separate button to single click access to moving tasks around having to go to a submenu for such a routine task becomes frustrating in the long term.
The app is really helpful and keeps improving. However I would love if we could set the minutes before any scheduled activity!
Followed your instructions and it works thanks for getting back to us
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
Have you set up the sync repository (location) for saving the notebooks to? This is done in Settings / Sync / Repositories.

Syncing to external SD card is supported with this method.

Export from notebook list is just a quick way to write a notebook to Downloads directory. It's not meant for periodic usage.

Thanks for the review!

google_play_reviews.content: 1. Doesn't support org-agenda search operator. Please don't reinvent the wheel. 2. Doesn't support PGP encryption.
Great app! Helps me being organized in convenient way and without sharing my data with third parties. Exported files can be viewed and edited without additional software on any device.
Great for organizing tasks and projects and a easy and nice way to work with OrgMode files.
Great app. Emacs Org Mode functionality on my phone. Love it.

Very well thought out app. I will say it isn't very intuitive like most productivity apps. The provided example was enough for me to work my around the app! This app is everything I've been looking for! I was searching for an application (almost decided to make my own) that supported nested to-dos, and none that I found appealed to me. Orgzly is just what I need to put my thoughts on....paper. Great app if you take the time to get used to it. Lots of functionality and customizability!

Great app. I'd love to see org-drill implemented into it as well, and maybe the option of Google calendar sync, but only if it doesn't break any current functionality because as is, it's awesome! Also: Drive sync, archiving, and attachment support! Oh, and inline todos support please.
Wish all apps were made this well. I have notebooks over 350k in size. Orgzly doesn't slow down one bit.
Excellent. This works both as an introduction to org-mode and as a way to access and edit org files on Android devices. Very elegant.
This is the app I have been waiting for. Finally able to use org-mode on my computer and have my todos synced to my phone. Thank you developers!
Highly recommended app. I rely on this every day!
It makes org-mode easy and intuitive on your phone. Can't ask for much more than that.
I would love to see Google drive sync!
Excellent app. Keeps getting better.

I use this app all the time. It integrates with my org mode files, synced 
using foldersync with my nextcloud server. Great design and functionality. 
Keeps getting better, too
Emacs org-mode on phone -- great! I hope auto-syncing would be available soon.

I love the app. Really simple, really useful.  What I like: +Limitless levels +Can assign expiration date/deadline +Tagging +Checkboxes +Styling +Search +Simple, easy to read export format  And few complaints: -Can't assign my own priority (like "important", or "urgent, not important") -Can't assign color to a priority -Can't assign my own state.  And last, but not least. It would be awesome to have (maybe like a premium feature) full functioning web app.  Overall it's a great app! Keep it up!  EDIT: It also would be great if you add Google Drive support.)

Hi, this desperately needs a widget which can show an open notebook. Then 
I'll give 5 stars
Excellent app for using Org mode on phone. Nice user interface.
So great! been looking for something like this for a long time

best orgmode app I've seen, would be great to merge some of Workflowy's ui 
goodies
Thank you!

tl;dr Great app! Perfect for my needs! I'm using it with Vim and an 
Org-Mode like plugin on the desktop and sync it easily to my phone.

This is the first app review I have ever written, but this app has earned 
it. It has a great, clean interface, it works out of the box and it's emacs.

Wonderful way to bring the power of org-mode to mobile. Works really well 
for notes and TODOs, and all in a future proof plain text format.

One of a kind. ● Organizing events and tasks, with long titles and notes 
support. ● I can view the big picture of a whole. — Even better. Well done! 
Thanks
I love org mode
I just love it.
awesome!

Really nice and helpful. But I am facing a problem while testing it before 
putting it to serious use. I cannot find a way to cancel the operation in 
case I "cut" something and do not remember the original location of the 
"cut" operation to paste again and restore it.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Yes, sounds like Undo for cutting (and many other operations) is needed. Also a way to paste to an empty notebook, which is related to this issue. It will be fixed, thanks for the review!

google_play_reviews.content:
Million thanks to the developers for this app. Wonderful implementation. 
Can't cut&move multiple entries, though. Will this feature be added in the 
future?
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Yes, it's definitely planned. Thanks for the review!

google_play_reviews.content:
You can also sync your notes via Syncthing, so you don't need third party 
cloud providers for this.

It's a very nice application: good UI, stability and features. The main 
disadvantage: you must tap the Sync button before and after every usage (I 
use dropbox and several devices). The possible solution for the developer 
it is to implement automerge function or periodically do autosync

Better than heavy gtasks integrated apps. Just wish we could sync it with 
Google drive or onedrive instead of Dropbox

Orgzly is really, really good. In fact, it's enough to make me start using 
org mode again seriously on my computer. Org files look better in orgzly 
than in Aquamacs, at least with my simple setup. For me, dropbox sync works 
perfectly, albeit manually. I did have a bit of a struggle before I managed 
to capitalize the name of a notebook and make it stick on both ends, but 
that was probably Mac OS's fault since its file system is not case 
sensitive. In addition to the suggestions in other reviews, I'd like to ask 
for list support. And how about letting us edit the underlying org file as 
plain text for us diehards that prefer counting stars and other markup to 
trying to figure out the state of a chunk of text? (It can kind of be done 
using Emacs on Termux.)

This app is fantastic, it's one of the most flexible ones for organizing 
your life. You can take notes, create checklists, keep track of your 
appointments and deadlines and it has the most elaborate search system one 
could need. And on top of that it's actively developed and has great 
potential to improve even more. Simply a pleasure to use, props to the devs.

Love the app, except that I can't undo an accidental deletion of a note. 
Which is due to the long press selection of a note, and the corresponding 
scissors icon. Which after one click, "cuts" your note from the notebook 
but in reality deletes it, since there's not corresponding clipboard to cut 
to. Which is misleading and just bad UI design. Just lost a solid 45 min of 
writing, bc I thought it was a cut and paste. So somewhat upset. Might be 
being a bit vindictive with the two stars.. should probably be four, but 
this is mainly to call attention to the issue. Sorry and thanks Dev!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Yes, this is known issue - you have to select another note so you can paste what you cut. Perhaps it's not too late? It will be fixed though - pasting should be possible even if notebook is empty. Thanks for the review!

google_play_reviews.content: Best org manager

Two points I was looking for other than cloud sync - Encrypt note with 
master key, Collaboration with other users. Required for managing small 
scale projects.
Best app on Android for org-mode users. Would be five star if it can sync  to and from remote repositories like dropbox automatically. Are there any plans on implementing such a feature?
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Yes, auto-sync when using Dropbox is currently disabled as it is too easy to hit per-user API limits. A bit smarter sync will be implemented and auto-sync for remote repositories re-enabled. Thanks for the review!

google_play_reviews.content: Thanks for the recent updates!

Thank you so much for your generosity in making this wonderful app 
available for free, and without ads. That is rare. It's amazing, reliable 
and probably one of the best apps I have on my phone.

It's very good, just needs a few more features and improvements. 1. Need 
something like the Workflowy zoom in feature, so that you can concentrate 
on a section of a Very large outliner. 2. It's not easy to quickly add a 
bunch of sub tasks to a top level note. You have to repeatedly swipe the 
top level note to reveal the menu and the icons for adding are not very 
intuitive, if the zoom in feature is implemented then this process can be 
simplified. 3. Clicking the head node should open the sub nodes menu 
instead of having to click on a tiny + sign.
Good for taking Notes, ToDo, Reminders, Lists. One of the best organiser apps. Slightly complicated. Recommended for young users.
It works like a charm (minor issues with syncing which I hope will go away with updates). Thanks
Great app! Awesome org-mode support.

This is a great app! I love org-mode and this extends its use to my smartphone just the way I need. I love the improvements made recently! The UI is very polished and I found it easy to use. Sync works well out of the box, and capturing on my smartphone is super easy! Highly recommend this for anyone who uses org-mode. If you don't use org-mode, you might want to consider it.
Looks great but takes a while to getting used to
Love the app! Dropbox and other repository integration is a killer feature. Would be nice to have a more organized view of notebooks though (e.g. grouped by repository).

Love it! Simple and fast with a great widget as well. Much more complex than my needs, but simple enough that I could adapt it for my needs. The only thing I am missing is the ability to share the outline,(like to Google Docs, Google Drive, or email). Perhaps it can, but I don't know how.
That's exactly what I was looking for, thanks!

Hello developer! App is great, a little bit complicated, but overall really useful. Some features make this app unique.  App icon on Android 8.0 is not so nice. Not in circle Share function is missing. Thanks

Very well polished and useable org-mode on Android. No git integration is a pain. If it had git, would get 5 stars for sure. Hoping git sync is high on the todo list. Also curious if captures and exports will ever be supported.
Application note but can't copy paste a sub note.
Game changer app
Plenty of options. Ad free. But there's an issue, after changing app settings, can not open the notebook. I hope you will look into it. Thanks.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Drop us an email about that so we can figure it out. Thanks for the review!

google_play_reviews.content: One of the best notetaking apps ever. Simple and free, fast and ad-free!!
Attaching pics, drawings and recording voice messages is really needed.
I just love it..

Looks pretty good. It's been only a few days since I started using it though. It has a lot of cool features and is free! Have not seen any ads in it either. The code is openly available on GitHub. Thanks! How can I donate a few bucks? :)

Thanks for this app! For now I'll be using it to take notes when I'm away from my computer and Emacs. One thing would make the app much more useful for me: the ability to sync multiple directory levels.

Originally used this app for GTD productivity, now realize it is a powerful Bullet Journal digital replacement.  Terrific functionality and it appears customizable in multiple ways. Love it.  Go-to for keeping my notes and tasks organized.  The developer is responsive and continues to make improvements.  Highly recommend!  Would like to see a few improvements such as a web app, and the ability to select multiple bullets and move them at once.

Great app for org-mode files. My previous complaints were that it was not free as in freedom and didn't support auto-sync, however both of these issues have been fixed in the current version. Much more stable and actually usable compared to MobileOrg. Also has a nice dark theme. Highly recommended.
The keystone of a viable org-mode organization suite.
This is one of the best and I have tried dozens of note apps. The o e thing that would make the number one notes app is location tagging and location reminders..

Everything I ever wanted in a notes app - actually uses files which allows me to sync them with my services however I want to. I cannot believe that notes need to be any more complicated than this and that it took so long for something like this to come out. Its perfectly simple and simply perfect, I sync it back to my server/computers and can peacefully edit the same files in emacs.
The best among org-mode apps.

Finally a nice app that links my org-mode files on mobile. I think that the only missing thing is a git integration. Would also be nice to see checkboxes. Bottom line - Amazing App. Keep up the good work!!!
There's a limit on the number of levels deep in the list. Dynalist is better.

excellent app for creating org-mode notes. best feature is storing everything in text files. only feature I would like to add is git integration, but right now I use a termux widget to get around that - so it's not a deal-breaker by any means. get it and you won't be disappointed.

For a while I used Orgzly because it was the least bad alternative. Development speed has really picked up recently, though. It feels like every other day there's a new feature that's actually very well thought through. At this pace it will be amazing in not too long.
Great app, however it could be nice if it supported onedrive
it's has an ui as good as the rival task/notes apps , but the orgmode format is much more powerful and future proof than any other solution.
this is exactly what I have been waiting for: a perfect way to use org mode on mobile. thank you so much for developing!!

Orgzly is simply amazing. The new features make this much more powerful, and at this rate of development the app will soon do anything org-mode you'd ever want to do on a phone, plus some more. It also keeps everything simple and quickly usable on the go. This is a great note-taking app even if you don't use org-mode on a computer.
